datafield.subfield: Register of families serving as members of the Nuremberg Council (eighty-five), other office-holding families (twenty-three), and other influential families (twenty-eight), with descriptions of their coats of arms and other information culled from annals, church memorials, and other archival records from the 12th-17th centuries :
Unrestricted, for either reading room or classroom use.

MS 3327, Container 94: Acquired by the Ransom Center in 1969 (R4998). Binding (Zaehnsdorf, late 19th c): Full brown tanned calfskin over paper boards. Pulled-over caps, cut-solid edges gilded, tight back over sewing supports. Stain decoration (sprinkled); gold-tooled double-line border with gold-tooled rosettes at corners, front and back covers; gold-tooled decorative rolls board edges, turn-ins; heavily gold-tooled spine; gold-tooled dark green and brown tanned goatskin title labels (2d/3d panels). Sewn on five supports (not visible) laced on boards. Sewn endbands (green/red/white) over parchment/laminate (?) cores, front bead. Endleaf components: front tipped folds (two nested) off-white handmade paper making stub, pastedown, two free endleaves; back same.
Medieval and Early Modern Manuscripts Collection.
Medieval and Early Modern Manuscripts Collection.
